headline: New Georgia law requires recess, but has several exceptions
sentences: It is time for our students to get moving and learn how to play with each other again,? state Rep. Demetrius Douglas, the Stockbridge Democrat and former Georgia football player who sponsored the bill, told WSB-TV.
Recess can be waived on days when students have physical education or other structured activity time,? such as games led by a teacher, the Atlanta Journal Constitution reported.
Younger students spend all day in one room, since they dont move from class to class as middle and high school students do, he told news outlets.
A new Georgia law requires daily recess for most elementary students, but doesnt say how long recess should last and includes some exceptions.
Douglas told WAGA-TV that he took a 30-minute requirement out of the new law after meeting with members of the governors staff.
Three years ago, Kemp vetoed a bill that urged schools to provide an average of 30 minutes of recess per day.
It also can be skipped for scheduling conflicts, bad weather, field trips or other unavoidable obstacles.
Brian Kemp signed the law, which covers students through fifth grade, on Monday, news outlets reported.
Absolutely, and Im thrilled with just a start,? he said.
